info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 30 at 3:24PM PST until December 31 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches. North to northwest winds gusting to 45 mph. * WHERE...In California, Modoc County including Cedar Pass on Highway 299 and portions of Highway 395. In Oregon, Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County and Central and Eastern Lake County including portions of Highway 31 near Summer Lake and Highway 395 at Lakeview and Warner Mountain Summit. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening and morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Some snowfall is expected, but the gusty winds with blowing snow and reduced visibility is expected to be the main impact. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
